sentences.en: A superficial injury is not serious.
Beneath his refined manners and superficial elegance lay something treacherous.
sentences.cn: 在他温文尔雅、貌似高贵的举止下隐藏着某种奸诈。

sentences.en: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.cn: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.en: Despite these superficial resemblances, this is a darker work than her earlier novels.
sentences.cn: 尽管表面上有一些相似之处，但这本著作实际要比她以前的小说悲观。

sentences.en: He has a superficial knowledge of this subject.
sentences.cn: 他对这门学科略知皮毛.

sentences.en: He now frankly admits that much of his former playboy lifestyle was superficial.
sentences.cn: 他现在坦率承认自己以前浪荡不羁的生活方式很大程度上都是浅薄的。

sentences.en: Her speech was superficial and full of generalities.
I know well how slight is my talent and how superficial my scholarship , and that I do not deserve so much praise.
sentences.cn: 深知自己才疏学浅, 不称揄扬.
这是一本立论肤浅的书.

sentences.en: Michael's roommate had been pleasant on a superficial level.
sentences.cn: 迈克尔的室友表面上还算友善。

sentences.en: Spain may well look different but the changes are superficial.
sentences.cn: 西班牙可能看起来与以前有很大不同，但这些变化都是表面上的。

sentences.en: The 69-year-old clergyman escaped with superficial wounds.
sentences.cn: 69岁的牧师幸免于难，只受了点皮肉伤。

sentences.en: The other injured man had a superficial stomach wound.
sentences.cn: 另一名受伤男子是腹部的皮外伤。

sentences.en: The tone of his book is consistently negative, occasionally arrogant, and often superficial.
sentences.cn: 他的书基调一贯是负面消极的，有时还有点儿傲慢自大，且常常流于肤浅。

sentences.en: Their arguments do not withstand the most superficial scrutiny.
sentences.cn: 他们的论据经不起一点推敲。

sentences.en: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
sentences.cn: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

sentences.en: Under stress these people will appear to be superficial, over-eager and manipulative.
sentences.cn: 这些人在压力下会显得浅薄无知、操之过急，而且爱摆布人。

sentences.en: You're too superficial to appreciate great literature like this.
sentences.cn: 你太肤浅,无法欣赏这类文学巨著.

words.tran_cn: 浅薄，肤浅；表面性的事物
表面文章；外表；浅薄的人

trans.tran_cn: 表面（上）的，肤浅的，缺乏深度的，一知半解的
trans.tran_en: not studying or looking at something carefully and only seeing the most noticeable things
